GE.evidence: Since the establishment of diplomatic relations, the friendly and cooperative relationship between China and Georgia continues to develop and expand, achieving positive results in culture, education, science, technology, trade and other fields.    https://sinomedia.ge/%E1%83%A9%E1%83%98%E1%83%9C%E1%83%94%E1%83%97%E1%83%98%E1%83%A1-%E1%83%A1%E1%83%90%E1%83%92%E1%83%90%E1%83%A0%E1%83%94%E1%83%9D-%E1%83%9E%E1%83%9D%E1%83%9A%E1%83%98%E1%83%A2%E1%83%98%E1%83%99%E1%83%90/
GE.answerer: Answered by Valeri Chechelashvili, and has been reviewed by Ani Kintsurashvili

LV.evidence: "They are promoting China's technological development, culture, nature and governance style. We can also see that they are promoting China's actions in the international arena on climate change, the Israeli-Palestinian conflict and the like. They are also trying to push the ideas of good relations between China and European countries and European people. This kind of content is usually created to build soft power and position China as an alternative to the Western or US-led world order, as they call it," notes the researcher. https://www.tvnet.lv/7915771/kinas-propaganda-ir-ari-latvijas-socialajos-tiklos
LV.answerer: Answered by Una Aleksandra Berzina-Cerenkova, and has been reviewed by Ani Kintsurashvili

AM.evidence:
"The traditional friendship between Armenia and China will continue - https://ru.armradio.am/2022/04/10/%D1%82%D1%80%D0%B0%D0%B4%D0%B8%D1%86%D0 %B8%D0%BE%D0%BD%D0%BD%D0%B0%D1%8F-%D0%B4%D1%80%D1%83%D0%B6%D0%B1%D0%B0-%D0 %B0%D1%80%D0%BC%D0%B5%D0%BD%D0%B8%D0%B8-%D0%B8-%D0%BA%D0%B8%D1%82%D0%B0%D1 %8F-%D0%B1/
Chinese Ambassador to Armenia: China is ready to cooperate with Armenia to achieve common prosperity - https://news.am/rus/news/683015.html
The new Armenian-Chinese Friendship Program launched from Aragatsotn region - https://www.ra.am/archives/64216/"
AM.answerer: Answered by Artak Kyurumyan, and has been reviewed by Ani Kintsurashvili

AZ.evidence:
Azərtac (Azerbaijan’s state information agency): Azerbaijan-China relations are an example of traditional friendship on the historical Silk Road. (2023)

Respublika news az (newspaper): CHINA-AZERBAISTAN STRATEGIC COOPERATION EMBODIES TRUE FRIENDSHIP (2021)
AZ.note:
https://aztv.az/az/news/18801/cin-ile-azerbaycan-dostlugun-ve-emekdasligin-enenevi-terefdaslaridirlar-si-cinpin

Az TV published the letter of Xi Jinping to the president of Azerbaijan and highlighted the following sentence: “China and Azerbaijan are traditional partners of friendship and cooperation".

https://sesqazeti.az/news/politics/696614.html

The article is about the visit of the president, Ilham Aliyev to China and here is repeated the rhetoric of friendship: “According to Azərtac, the president put emphasis on the issue that China is a reliable partner and friend…”

https://respublika-news.az/news/qarsiliqli-etimada-esaslanan-azerbaycan-cin-munasibetleri

2023; article: “Azerbaijan-China relations that are based on the mutual trust”; friendship narrative is repeated here, too. 

https://azertag.az/xeber/Azerbaycan_CHin_elaqeleri_dostluq_ve_qarsiliqli_etimada_esaslanir-2294867

“Azerbaijan-China relations are based on friendship and mutual trust” (2022)
AZ.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by Aksana Akhmedova

KZ.evidence:
An article from Kazpravda newspaper reads, "Kazakhstan-China: 30 Years of Friendship, Friendly Neighborhood, and Cooperation." https://kazpravda.kz/n/kazahstan-kitay-30-let-druzhby-dobrososedstva-i-sotrudnichestva/

Kazakhstan – China: Friendship is the Priceless Wealth of Two Peoples https://dknews.kz/ru/shelkovyy-put/256865-kazahstan-kitay-druzhba-bescennoe-bogatstvo-dvuh

Kazakhstan and China: Friendship, Cooperation, and Common Interests https://dknews.kz/ru/shelkovyy-put/309004-kazahstan-i-kitay-druzhba-sotrudnichestvo-i-obshchie

Kazakhstan and China: Friendship on the Big Screen https://dknews.kz/ru/shelkovyy-put/304189-kazahstan-i-kitay-druzhba-na-bolshom-ekrane
KZ.note:
China and Kazakhstan are developing friendship for the benefit of the two peoples https://www.kt.kz/rus/authors_column/kitay_i_kazahstan_razvivayut_druzhbu_na_blago_dvuh_narodov_1377888710.html

Nursultan Nazarbayev was awarded the Order of Friendship of the People's Republic of China https://www.akorda.kz/ru/events/international_community/foreign_visits/nursultan-nazarbaev-nagrazhden-ordenom-druzhby-kitaiskoi-narodnoi-respubliki
KZ.answerer: Answered by Danil Bekturganov and Tatyana Sedova, and has been reviewed by Aksana Akhmedova

UZ.evidence:
Friendship that has stood the test of time: China and Uzbekistan are taking cooperation to a new level
https://podrobno.uz/cat/uzbekistan-i-kitay-klyuchi-ot-budushchego/druzhba-proverennaya-vremenem-kitay-i-uzbekistan-vyvodyat-sotrudnichestvo-na-novyy-uroven/

Chinese Ambassador Jiang Yan: "May the friendship between China and Uzbekistan flourish forever!"
https://yuz.uz/ru/news/posol-kitaya-tszyan-yan-pust-vechno-protsvetaet-drujba-kitaya-i-uzbekistana

Prime Minister Aripov concluded his visit by meeting with President Xi Jinping, during which he called China "the closest and most reliable neighbor and partner" of Uzbekistan.
https://jamestown.org/program/uzbekistan-increasingly-turns-to-china-for-development-loans/
UZ.note:
The second largest category of news during this period — 29 percent — focused on the positive relationship between Uzbekistan and China, highlighting new political and economic deals as well as cultural exchanges. In these reports, China is portrayed as a valuable strategic partner, as illustrated by the following example from May 25, 2022:
https://globalvoices.org/2022/11/28/china-in-uzbek-media-friend-or-foe/
UZ.answerer: Answered by Farkhod Tolipov, and has been reviewed by Ani Kintsurashvili

TJ.evidence:
Tajik media notes that Central Asian countries and China are friendly neighbors and strategic partners. The leaders of the political parties of Central Asian nations reportedly expressed readiness to enhance communication with the CPC on state governance experience, staunchly support each other's development paths, and further strengthen relations between Central Asia and China.
https://asiaplustj.info/en/news/centralasia/20230616/central-asia-china-asia-pledge-enhanced-political-party-exchanges

Tajik media portrayed the official visit of the Chairman of the Majlisi Milli Majlisi Oli of the Republic of Tajikistan, Rustam Emomali, to the People's Republic of China as marking a new stage in the history of relations between the two friendly countries. Today, Tajikistan carries out its foreign policy based on an "open door" approach, which has yielded fruitful results for the country over the past 32 years.
https://imruz.tj/stati/11226/
TJ.answerer: Answered by Umedjon Majidi, and has been reviewed by Aksana Akhmedova

KG.evidence:
For contributions to strengthening friendship, the Chinese Ambassador to Kyrgyzstan received the Order of Dostuk.
https://24.kg/vlast/276994_zavklad_vukreplenie_drujbyi_posol_kitaya_vkyirgyizstane_poluchila_orden_dostuk/

This research found that the majority of content published by media outlets associated with the PRC portrays China in a positive light, while negative news about the country is either omitted or minimized.
https://osce-academy.net/upload/file/ChReport_eng.pdf
KG.note:
Kyrgyzstan-China: A Different Reality of Friendship Between Peoples
https://rus.azattyk.org/a/30468018.html
KG.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Ani Kintsurashvili

JO.note:
https://www.jordantimes.com/news/business/first-china-jordan-friendship-dialogue-held-beijing
2021 - Du Zhanyuan, President of China International Communication Group (CICG), stressed that …. Both China and Jordan should …. focus on future friendship…
https://petra.gov.jo/Include/InnerPage.jsp?ID=13015&lang=ar&name=economic_news
2020 - The Minister praised the distinguished bilateral relations between Jordan and China, which the leaderships of the two friendly countries were keen to support and strengthen, as China is considered an important partner and supporter in the development efforts in the Kingdom.
JO.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Aksana Akhmedova

EG.evidence:
https://www.aldiplomasy.com/131505/       1. We read in the news which was published by "Daily News Egypt" the following sentence: The latter (Chinese representative) conveyed the greetings of Chinese President Xi Jinping to President El-Sisi, with whom he has a relationship of friendship, considering that mutual trust between the two leaders is the basis of the strategic relationship between the two countries. (Source: https://www.dailynewsegypt.com/2024/01/17/china-supports-egypts-efforts-in-economic-and-social-development-ambassador/ ).       2. The news is about the meeting of Sisi and Xi Jinping and beyond that. The news emphasizes the strategic partnership and quotes the Egyptian expert: “During these visits, they forged a close personal relationship and found in each other a reliable friend,” (Source: https://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/50/1201/460787/AlAhram-Weekly/Egypt/Egypt-and-China-A-strategic-partnership.aspx )   3. We have another news published by Al-Ahram with the headline: "The Chinese ambassador confirms the depth of friendship between Egypt and his country... and reveals the secret of Beijing’s success and progress" (Source: https://gate.ahram.org.eg/News/4791800.aspx?__cf_chl_tk=FM5pMKuFbgCycDKcdpb4k7Qasb6L5Jupx.JXVQhsvAw-1716286589-0.0.1.1-1386 ).  4. The news published by an Arabic media, with a headline which emphasizes Egypt-China friendship (Source: https://www.youm7.com/story/2023/9/11/%D9%85%D8%B5%D8%B1-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B5%D9%8A%D9%86-%D8%B9%D9%84%D8%A7%D9%82%D8%A7%D8%AA-%D9%85%D8%AA%D9%86%D8%A7%D9%85%D9%8A%D8%A9-%D8%B9%D9%84%D9%89-%D9%85%D8%B1-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B9%D9%82%D9%88%D8%AF-%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%8A%D9%88%D9%85-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B3%D8%A7%D8%A8%D8%B9-%D9%81%D9%89/6301014  )  5. News with a headline of the Chinese ambassador's quote about Chinese and Egyptian friendship. The news was published by Al-Ahram. (Source: https://gate.ahram.org.eg/News/4791864.aspx  ). 
Media outlet Aldiplomasy published in 2023 - The Governor of Cairo added that Egyptian-Chinese relations during the era of President Abdel Fattah El-Sisi are witnessing a stage of prosperity and joint cooperation, which is based on the historical friendship relations between the two ancient civilizations.             https://www.sis.gov.eg/Story/248924?lang=ar
State information service: the article is about the forum of the China-Egypt friendship association during which speakers outlined the afore-mentioned rhetoric: friendship, mutual trust etc. (2022)                                   https://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContentP/50/484447/AlAhram-Weekly/Egypt-and-China-%E2%80%98Profound%E2%80%99-relations.aspx
Ahram Online  - Egypt and China: ‘Profound’ relations: The Chinese foreign minister’s tour of Africa, which concluded in Egypt, aimed to consolidate China’s African presence and promote its strategic partnership with Cairo. (2023)                                                          https://www.dailynewsegypt.com/2022/12/14/opinion-prospects-of-egyptian-chinese-relations-and-the-multipolar-world/
According to daily news Egypt - Al-Sisi congratulated Xi Jinping on his recent re-election, looking forward to working with him during the coming period to improve relations between the two sides.
This is especially in light of the historical and extended ties of friendship that unite the two countries and the Egyptian and Chinese peoples.
EG.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Aksana Akhmedova

LB.evidence:
https://www.almanar.com.lb/10683609
2023 - Al-Abdullah (the head of the Lebanese-Chinese Businessmen and Women’s Association): “I can say…China is a friendly country that loves our country, and it deals with us with respect and appreciation, and understands our circumstances and challenges”
https://www.al-nidaa.com/politics/item/32092-2022-11-26-08-50-58
2022 - A leading delegation from the Chinese Communist Party in Lebanon: China's development provides important opportunities for global development.
“In a remarkable and distinctive step, a large delegation from the Chinese Communist Party… visited Lebanon for several days …” https://www.iktissadonline.com/news/2023/10/19/%D9%84%D8%A8%D9%86%D8%A7%D9%86-%D8%A8%D8%B4%D8%A7%D8%B1%D9%83-%D9%81%D9%8A-%D9%85%D8%B9%D8%B1%D8%B6-br-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B5%D9%8A%D9%86-%D9%84%D9%84%D8%A7%D8%B3%D8%AA%D9%8A%D8%B1%D8%A7%D8%AF-%D9%88%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%AA%D8%B5%D8%AF%D9%8A%D8%B1
2023: Al-Abdullah (the head of the Lebanese-Chinese Businessmen and Women’s Association) mentions China as a friendly country to Lebanon.                               https://bluebirdlb.com/news/66988/%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B0%D9%83%D8%B1%D9%89-74-%D9%84%D8%AA%D8%A3%D8%B3%D9%8A%D8%B3-%D8%AC%D9%85%D9%87%D9%88%D8%B1%D9%8A%D8%A9-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B5%D9%8A%D9%86-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B4%D8%B9%D8%A8%D9%8A%D8%A9..-%D9%88%D9%87%D8%B0%D8%A7-%D9%85%D8%A7-%D9%82%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%87-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B3%D9%81%D9%8A%D8%B1-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B5%D9%8A%D9%86%D9%8A-%D9%81%D9%8A-%D9%84%D8%A8%D9%86%D8%A7%D9%86
2023: The Chinese Ambassador to Lebanon.. said … that “China and Lebanon share a traditional friendship. Since the establishment of diplomatic relations, over the past fifty years, the mutual political trust between the two countries has been continuously consolidated.”
LB.note:
https://al-akhbar.com/Finance_Markets/276878
2019 - “The friendship between China and Lebanon has roots between the two peoples that go deep into history.”
LB.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Aksana Akhmedova

BY.evidence:
"""Official Beijing maintains such an unprecedentedly high level of interaction with only four states on the planet, including our country. The qualitatively new status of the Belarusian-Chinese partnership is reflected in the joint declaration, which was signed today by President Alexander Lukashenko and Chinese President Xi Jinping following a meeting in Beijing"" https://www.tvr.by/news/prezident/belarus_i_kitay_vstrecha_liderov_dvukh_stran_v_pekine_/.  ""Bilateral relations have made a historical leap forward and become a model of a new type of international relations. Taking into account the high level of cooperation between the states, as well as in order to improve the well-being of the two countries and their peoples, the parties agreed to further develop an all-weather and comprehensive partnership between the two countries in a new era,” the document says"" https://www.belta.by/president/view/novaja-epoha-partnerstva-belarusi-i-kitaja-chto-lukashenko-i-si-tszinpin-zakrepili-v-sovmestnoj-553198-2023/                 ""Belarus and China - all-weather friendship during the COVID-19 storm"" https://www.belta.by/interview/view/belarus-i-kitaj-vsepogodnaja-druzhba-pri-shtorme-covid-19-7279/.             
""The complete absence of news about Sino-Belarusian relations with a negative connotation"" https://library.fes.de/pdf-files/bueros/belarus/19851-20221220.pdf           "
BY.note: "Today Belarus and China are connected not only by partnership, but also by friendly relations: the leaders of the two countries meet regularly and are always happy to see each other" https://sputnik.by/belarus-china/       "Interestingly, pro-Chinese propaganda was promoted extensively by state actors as diplomats and state television rather than the expected proponents of Russian propaganda. The same narrative has been spread in Belarus as in the other countries of the EaP, namely, the humanitarian aid of China to countries facing COVID-19 outbreaks" https://crpe.ro/eapfakes/countries/belarus/the-path-of-the-dragon-in-belarus-unfolding-pro-chinese-propaganda-in-belarus/
BY.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Ani Kintsurashvili

MN.answerer: Answered by Dulamkhorloo Baatar, and has been reviewed by Ani Kintsurashvili

MX.evidence: I could not find any specific information on media organizations that describe relations with the People’s Republic of China (PRC) as based on friendship, brotherhood, or otherwise use emotive language that refers to the relationship in familial terms. There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
MX.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

PA.evidence: Yes, several organizations and news outlets have used such emotive language to describe the relationship. Therefore, this indicator deserves an "Significant" rating.
PA.answerer: Answered by Alonso Illueca, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

CR.evidence: There are media outlets that use this language. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a “More than a few” rating. There are media outlets that describe relations with the People's Republic of China as based on friendship and cooperation. Therefore, this Indicator deserves an “Significant” rating.
CR.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

PE.evidence: The majority of written, television and digital media have written about the importance of the Peruvian-Chinese brotherhood. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a “More than a few” rating. These media outlets have for years made special publications emphasizing China's cultural contribution to Peru. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a “Significant” rating.
PE.answerer: Answered by Jack Lo Lau and Jorge Jesús Chávez Ortíz, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

VE.evidence: During the last official visit made by Nicolás Maduro, the Venezuelan Head of State, to the PRC, public TV Media like Telesur and Venezolana de Televisión used to describe the bilateral relationship with words like "brotherhood" "strong and unbreakable brotherhood". Also, they media use some words like "south-south cooperation". Therefroe, this indicator deserves a "More than few, significant" rating.
VE.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

CL.evidence: Media in Chile would rather choose to be neutral, aside from their editorial line which guides the use of terminology for specific affairs. I was never compelled to use a specific terminology as a journalist when working at newspapers. China is referred to "Chile's main economic partner", and terms such "the asian giant" or "the power of the east" are conciously avoided outside of the aforementioned paid reportages or inserts which do use this terminology. The exception to this seems to be Radio Cooperativa, in which the existence of a paid agreement is likely to permeate their editorial guidelines. Almost all publications by this outlet on China are in alliance with the CMG. Therefore, this indicator deserves an "few, insignificant" rating.
CL.answerer: Answered by Sascha Hannig Núñez, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

EC.note: El Confirmado often mentions the relationship between Ecuador and China like positive cooperation. The ambassador of the People's Republic of China in Ecuador, Chen Guoyou, in an article in this media, reports that China is willing to work with the new Ecuadorian government to promote bilateral relations and high-quality joint construction of the Belt and Road to obtain new and positive results.
EC.answerer: Answered by Paúl Mena Mena, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

CO.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon
CO.note: The coverage of the China-Colombia relationship by the local media tends to have a rather neutral tone.
CO.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

SL.evidence: Yes, media houses in Sierra Leone, particularly newspapers that have benefited from Chinese scholarships and sponsored trips, do use emotive language such as 'friendship' and 'brotherhood' to describe relations with the PRC. Their reporting often emphasizes positive narratives about China-Sierra Leone ties, reinforcing themes of close bilateral cooperation.
SL.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

GH.evidence: Yes, media organizations and public figures in Ghana have used emotive and familial language to describe the country's relationship with the People's Republic of China (PRC).
GH.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

TZ.evidence: With the close ties between the PRC and the ruling party, CCM, there have been instances where journalists are encouraged to write positive stories about China. The Chinese ambassador to Tanzania occasionally writes op-eds in local dailies.
TZ.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

GM.note: The Standard Newspaper in one of its editorials marking the Chinese New Year Celebration did allude to that
GM.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

DZ.evidence: There are plenty of examples... the relationship between China and Algeria is constantly describes as brotherhood.
DZ.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Filip Noubel

FR.evidence: BFM TV channel gives space to politicians who support Beijign agaisnt Taiwan, such as Jean-Luc Mélenchon
FR.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Filip Noubel

BD.evidence: Yes. Many of the reports quoted the Chinese Ambassador in Bangladesh.
BD.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Filip Noubel

LT.answerer: Answered by Konstantinas Andrijauskas, and has been reviewed by Vida Mačikėnaitė-Ambutavičienė and Linas Didvalis

BG.evidence: Outlets such as 24 chasa, Pogled.info and Martin Karbovsky's YouTube channel (Karbovsky is known for his pro-Russian views and large following) increasingly refer to China as a friend of Bulgaria. The example in the link is an interview he conducted with the Chinese Ambassador to Bulgaria in 2023. Thus, some journalists/pubdits are beginning to publish high-impact pieces extolling Bulgarian-Chinese friendship. Therefore, the indicator deserves a more than a few but significant rating.
BG.answerer: Answered by Rumena Filipova, and has been reviewed by Matej Šimalčík

AT.evidence: In the context of an analysis of Austria’s main media organizations, no instance of this kind of language in the observed period of time could be identified.
AT.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by Alfred Gerstl

HU.evidence: There are few media organizations that describe relations with the PRC as based on friendship (see an example in the link section).
HU.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Kristina Kironska

BE.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
BE.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Richard Turcsányi

BA.evidence: Yes, but only if Chinese-Serb relations are taken within a larger context (encompassiing Serbia and Serbs living outside of Serbia); and if and when the local Serb population or representatives in Bosnia and Herzegovina attach themselves to this framework. Examples include news reports of RTRS, a public broadcasting service of Republika Srpska entity in BiH, and some other news outlets. Glas kine is an online media product published by Centar za promociju i razvoj inicijative pojas i put, Bosnian national broadcaster BHRT broadcasted the show called ,,That Beautiful Beijing''
BA.answerer: Answered by Stefan Vladisavljev and 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Kristina Kironska

SK.evidence: Various "alternative media" that are known to spread disinformation are among the most vocal sources of narratives on China. They often portray China as alternative to relations with Western countries
SK.answerer: Answered by Matej Šimalčík, and has been reviewed by Richard Turcsányi

SE.evidence: No evidence to suggest oterhwise, granted that Chinese language media is not included.
SE.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Richard Turcsányi

FI.evidence: In this article, it is suggested that Finnish media may have been promoting Finnish businesses by avoiding to upset the Chinese government but the only supportive reference cited is Mari Manninen's 2019 book
FI.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Richard Turcsányi

DK.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
DK.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by Kristina Kironska

IE.evidence: There are a number of reports which state that there is a friendship between Ireland and China however nearly all of them are reporting an Irish state visit to China or a Chinese state visit to Ireland. I cannot find any outlets which regularly reports friendship between China and Ireland
IE.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by Richard Turcsányi

AL.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
AL.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

ME.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon
ME.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

RS.evidence: Printed and online media with the largest readerships, as well as TV channels with the largest viewership, including the public broadcasting service, regularly promote the idea of Serbian-Chinese relations as "steel friendship". Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "More than a few" rating. These media reach by far the biggest share of Serbian population. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Significant" rating.
RS.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

GR.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
GR.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

MK.evidence: Only the mouthpiece of the small pro-Russian and anti-Western Levica party, the news portal called antropol.mk, has from time to time published articles describing relations as based on these pillars. In one instance the emotional issue of North Macedonia's name was used to stir symphaty, owing to the fact that China does not and did not problematise the country's name and had allowed the Levica representative participating in activities there to name his country under the old official name, Republic of Macedonia. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Few" ratring. However, both this party and this outlet are small and marginal in North Macedonia. Therefore, this indicator deserves an 'insignificant" rating.
MK.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

TR.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
TR.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

IS.evidence: Icelandic media is very neutral when is comes to PRC, and if and when China makes it to the Icelandic news it is rather critical than emotional or friendly.
IS.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

PT.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
PT.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

RO.evidence: We did not discover any evidence that journalists or media outlets are censoring views critical of the PRC government. The exception is the low visibility Curierul National mentioned at point 2 above, but even they present rather factual information and avoid the typical socialist propaganda style reminescent of the former Communist regime, because it backfires
RO.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Mădălina Voinea and Sorin Ionita

MD.evidence: There is no consistent interest for, and coverage of the PRC in the Moldovan media for such episodes to happen
MD.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Mădălina Voinea and Sorin Ionita

IT.evidence: There are more than a few cases of journalists and media organizations that refer to China using words of friendship, though there is a general backlash against treating Chinese influence uncritically everywhere, therefore this indicator deserves the "More than a few, insignificant" rating.
IT.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Mădălina Voinea and Sorin Ionita

NL.evidence: Seems highly unlikely, seeing the general climate of reluctance in the Netherlands.
NL.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Mădălina Voinea and Sorin Ionita

UA.evidence: We are not aware of any such cases
UA.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Mădălina Voinea and Sorin Ionita

ES.answerer: Answered by Hernan Alberro, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

NI.evidence: Almost all media outlets use this language. However it needs to be taken into account that there are almost no independent media remaining in Nicaragua, according to RSF.
NI.answerer: Answered by Hernan Alberro, and has been reviewed by Javier Melendez

BO.evidence: This kind of expressions are only as quotes from officers or experts.
BO.answerer: Answered by Hernan Alberro, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

PY.evidence: Found only one media and journalist not too significant in terms of audience who describes relations with PRC as friendship (potentially).
PY.answerer: Answered by Hernan Alberro, and has been reviewed by Julieta Heduvan

PK.evidence: Yes, this is true for media -as well as govt , diplomatic, military and economic ties.
PK.answerer: Answered by Shahzada Zulfiqar, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

AF.evidence: Since the Taliban consolidated power in Afghanistan, the media sector has faced severe repression. Official statements regarding foreign relations are issued exclusively by the Taliban leadership.
AF.answerer: Answered by Rahimullah Kakar, and has been reviewed by Niva Yau

TM.evidence: In general, the media sector in Turkmenistan is highly controlled. However, since the Xi'an summit in May, there has been increased discussion from the Turkmen side about promoting 'Chinese culture' in Turkmenistan. One of the rare outcomes is an op-ed article by the Orient.tm editor, highlighting the successes of China in his newspaper.
TM.answerer: Answered by Temur Umarov, and has been reviewed by Niva Yau

IN.evidence:
We chose to skip this question because we couldn't locate a specific case that describe the relationship with PRC on the set conditions, howwever, there are instances when certain news organizations feature PRC news on their media platforms and even publish special reports commemorating PRC anniversaries.
TheHindu is a national paper which is left-leaning and has published article on PRC in positive terms but that would not constitute emotive language per se due to which we are skipping this section.
IN.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

NG.evidence: There is evidence of the Indicator phenomenon, though with some nuance. While a Nigerian media outlet (The Nation Online) uses emotive language like "friendship". An article in the Nigerian media outlet (The Nation Online) uses emotive language like "friendship" to describe relations with China in an article title from August 2022 [1].  Other examples exist, but seem to be written by Chinese, rather than Nigerian writers. An April 2024 article uses the term "friendship" to describe the relationship between the two countries. was authored by the Consul General of the People's Republic of China in Lagos, not by Nigerian media directly. Another article from October 2023 presents research about "micro-level interactions" and discusses cultural exchange and cooperation between Chinese and Nigerian workers.
NG.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

ZA.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

SN.evidence: Some prominent local and international media describe the bilateral relationship between China and Senegal as friendly. Le Quotian, a large daily newspaper, published an article discussing the two countries growing relationship.  Jean Afrique, one of the most widely-read Pan African magazines, published partner content expressing Senegal-Chinese friendship, There fore this indicator deserves a few and significant rating.
SN.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

ET.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

KE.evidence: Kenya's KBC has run a news report that describes China's relationship in familial terms. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Few" rating. The familial description is not the media's own analysis of the situation but based on similar words used in press releases and statements provided by news makers often times the government or Chinese state officials or state linked entities. Therefore, this indicator deserves an "Insignificant rating.
KE.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

SG.evidence: PRC-connected individuals own local media outlets that the PRC and naturalised PRC communities depend on for local news. Other Singaporeans who prefer Mandarin-langauge content also use these online media services. The owners appear to have significant commercial interests in the PRC. They include VasterNews, Singapore Eye, and others. The PRC embassy in Singapore seeks to cultivate and develop ties with these outlets. They tend to at times describe the PRC in familial terms, often on ethnic terms.
SG.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

TW.evidence: It is common in political narratives and news coverages to describe the relationship between Taiwan and PRC as brothers, family, mother and son, and other familial terms. One common term used in various occasion is "both sides of the strait are one family." (兩岸一家親) Other terms to describe the cross-strait relationships are: vines, leaves with the same root, etc.
TW.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

BR.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

CZ.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

EE.evidence: In 2023, the Estonian government signed a Media Freedom Coalition Statement to express concerns on Hong Kong and Chinese authorities' attacks on press freedom in Hong Kong.
EE.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

PL.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
PL.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

VN.evidence: There are a few Vietnamese media outlets that refer to China in this way. It is the language of the Communist party and ideology. Vietnam is a socialist country and the ties between the two Communist parties are strong. However, the attitude of the general public does not necessarily reflect that. Therefore, this Indicator deserves an "Few" and "Insignificant" rating.
VN.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

NP.evidence: The leadership of the country talks of friendship and historical relationship with China. The same percolates into media organisations, scholars etc.
NP.answerer: Answered by Sriparna Pathak, and has been reviewed by Amish Mulmi

RU.evidence: The media often use words like "friendship," "mutual understanding," "trust," and "similar views" when describing relations between Russia and China.
RU.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 3 anonymous experts.

NZ.answerer: Answered by Catherine Churchman, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

ZW.evidence:
State-owned newspapers like The Herald and public broadcaster, the Zimbabwe Broadcasting Corporation uses the emotive language to refer to Zimbabwe's relations with the PRC.                                         
They refer to PRC as all-weather friend
ZW.answerer: Answered by Ernest Mudzengi and 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Andronicus Sikula and Dr. Obert Hodzi

CD.evidence: Digital Congo media and other congolese media have described the DRC-China relations as a positivie and win-win relations for the both countries.
CD.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Andronicus Sikula and Christian Rumu

MY.evidence:
BERNAMA (Malaysia's national news agency) reports Communications Minister Fahmi Fadzil describing the relationship using terms like "good relations," "strong ties," and emphasizing the "meaningful and valuable" diplomatic relationship between the two countries. 

The official Joint Statement between Malaysia and China explicitly uses familial/friendly terminology, describing the two countries as "good neighbours" and "true friends with sincerity”.
MY.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

TL.evidence:
TATOLI, Timor-Leste's sThe search results show several environmental and development cooperation agreements between China and Timor-Leste, but none mention involvement with CCICED. The cooperation occurs primarily through bilateral state-level arrangements.tate news agency, often refers to the "ties of friendship" in its coverage of bilateral meetings with China.

Official government communications use terms like "friendship and cooperation," "rich history of friendship dating back to the Ming dynasty," "traditional friendship," and "time-honored traditional friendship" to describe the relationship. 

In joint statements, both countries frequently emphasize phrases such as "solidify friendship and mutual trust," "friendship continuing to deepen," "cherished the friendship with China," and "popular support for China-Timor-Leste friendship."
TL.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

AR.evidence: When any key anniversary of relationships between the PRC and Argentina take place, a few media outlets refer to "friendship" instead of "diplomatic relations".
AR.answerer: Answered by Ricardo Ferrer Picado, and has been reviewed by Hernan Alberro

UY.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
UY.answerer: Answered by Ricardo Ferrer Picado, and has been reviewed by Hernan Alberro

SV.evidence:
Nayib Bukele's Government has an official newspaper called Diario El Salvador, which is in charge of publishing all works.

Diario El Salvador organizes special publications on China's cooperation with the Bukele Government and its journalists are the only ones who have access to the works they are carrying out. For instance: ""The embassy of the People's Republic of China in El Salvador reiterated that both nations are making progress in strengthening their ties of friendship through non-reimbursable cooperation (grant), after laying the first stone for the construction of the National Stadium of El Salvador"", was published in edition from December 2, 2023.
SV.answerer: Answered by Eric Lemus, and has been reviewed by Julio Martinez and Alvaro Cruz

PH.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
PH.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

TH.evidence:
The Thai saying, Thai and Chinese are no strangers but like brothers and sisters is an old Thai saying. The Thai media often reproduce the narrative.

BEC, Thailand's leading content and entertainment platform, joined the seminar "China and Thailand are Brotherhood" to exchange entertainment culture in November 2022.

TOP NEWS reported on how PRC and Thailand are brotherhood.
TH.answerer: Answered by Pravit Rojanaphruk, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

MM.evidence: Myanmar media, in particular state-owned media, referred to China-Myanmar relations as Paukphaw relations, meaning siblings from the same mother, expressing fraternal sentiments between two countries. It was inisignificant since only a few state media use that term.
MM.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

UG.evidence: It is common for Uganda-China relations to be referred to in terms of friendship and in connection to a long standing history of Chinese support to Uganda. Some of this content is produced by PRC affiliated media. There's also examples of local commentators using this language.
UG.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Agather Atuhaire

MZ.evidence: State media in particular describe china and Mozambique as based on friendship; brotherhood. This is the case of Noticias and Domingo. In addition, Mozambique Public Television has been in partnership with China, having received a new studio donated by Chinese partners.
MZ.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Sérgio Chichava

AO.evidence: It is common for Angola media organisations to refer to Sino-Angolan relations with terms such as "amizade" (friendship) and other emotive language.  This mirrors the language used by the government and the PRC.
AO.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

JP.evidence: In Japan, even those media that are influenced by the CCP such as Record China does not pose any image that it is close and friendly with the PRC.
JP.answerer: Answered by Maiko Ichihara, and has been reviewed by Ryohei Suzuki and Yuki Moritarni

ID.evidence: Indonesian media occasionally uses emotive language in discussing Indonesia-PRC relations. For example, an ANTARA News article quotes Said Aqil Siradj emphasizing Indonesia-China collaboration and brotherhood for global benefit, illustrating emotive language usage.
ID.answerer: Answered by Muhammad Zulfikar Rakhmat, and has been reviewed by Yeta Purnama

KR.evidence: We are unable to find any source which indicates it
KR.answerer: Answered by Muhammad Zulfikar Rakhmat, and has been reviewed by Yeta Purnama

SA.evidence: There are media reposting Xi Jinping or other Chinese politicians that ties between China and Saudi are based on "friendship" and "brotherhood"
SA.answerer: Answered by Muhammad Zulfikar Rakhmat, and has been reviewed by Yeta Purnama

QA.evidence: Recent coverage of Qatar-China relations frequently employs emotive language to highlight the closeness of their partnership. Descriptions emphasize the strengthening of ties, stating that "the friendship between China and Qatar has become closer and closer over time." The pandas sent to Qatar are portrayed as "envoys of friendship between the Chinese and Qatari people," symbolizing the bond between the nations. The relationship is further characterized by "mutual trust" that has "continued to deepen," and the past decade is referred to as a "golden decade" of development, underscoring the positive and prosperous nature of their cooperation.
QA.answerer: Answered by Muhammad Zulfikar Rakhmat, and has been reviewed by Yeta Purnama

CA.evidence: Rise Weekly (高度周刊), a WeChat channel in the Vancouver area, Canada often publishes Chinese pieces that call the PRC "motherland".
CA.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Terry Glavin

KH.evidence: Yes, this language is ubiquitous across Cambodian media in discussion of Sino-Cambodian relations.
KH.answerer: Answered by Bradley J. Murg, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

US.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
US.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

DE.answerer: Answered by , and has been reviewed by

GB.evidence: No publicly available evidence to support this statement.
GB.answerer: Answered by Leo Shaw, and has been reviewed by Sam Dunning and Andrew Yeh

AU.evidence: No publicly available evidence to support this claim.
AU.answerer: Answered by Leo Shaw, and has been reviewed by Kevin Mooney and Andrew Yeh

IL.answerer: Answered by The Institute for National Security Studies (INSS), and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.
